custommetadata:convert.description: Converts a custom object and all its records to an equivalent custom metadata type
examples:
$ sfdx custommetadata:convert --objname ConfigObject__c --visibility Public -u myOrg@org.com
  Congrats! Created a ConfigObject__mdt type with 32 records!

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

objname.name: objname
objname.description: DeveloperName of the object to create a type for

visibility.name: visibility
visibility.description: Visibility for the type. Valid values are 'Public' and 'Protected'. If blank, uses 'Public'

hello:org.description: Prints a greeting and your org id(s)!
examples:
$ sfdx hello:org --targetusername myOrg@example.com --targetdevhubusername devhub@org.com
  Hello world! This is org: MyOrg and I will be around until Tue Mar 20 2018!
  My hub org id is: 00Dxx000000001234

$ sfdx hello:org --name myname --targetusername myOrg@example.com
  Hello myname! This is org: MyOrg and I will be around until Tue Mar 20 2018!

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

targetdevhubusername.name: targetdevhubusername
targetdevhubusername.description: username or alias for the dev hub org; overrides default dev hub org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

custommetadata:record:create.description: Creates a new record for a given custom metadata type in the current project
examples:
$ sfdx custommetadata:record:create --typename MyCMT --recname MyRecord 
    Created custom metadata record of the type "MyCMT" with record developer name "MyRecord", label "MyRecord", and visibility "Public".

$ sfdx custommetadata:record:create --typename MyCMT --recname MyRecord --label "My Record" --protected true
    Created custom metadata record of the type "MyCMT" with record developer name "MyRecord", label "MyRecord", and visibility "Protected".

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

typename.name: typename
typename.description: DeveloperName of the type to create a record for

protection.name: protection
protection.description: Visibility for the record. If blank, uses false

custommetadata:type:create.description: Creates a new custom metadata type in the current project
examples:
$ sfdx custommetadata:type:create --devname MyCMT 
    Created custom metadata type with developer name "MyCMT", label "MyCMT", plural label "MyCMT", and visibility "Public".

$ sfdx custommetadata:type:create --devname MyCMT --label "Custom Type" --plurallabel "Custom Types" --visibility Protected
    Created custom metadata type with developer name "MyCMT", label "Custom Type", plural label "My Custom Metadata Type", and visibility "Protected".

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

plurallabel.name: plurallabel
plurallabel.description: Plural label for the type. If blank, uses label

visibility.name: visibility
visibility.description: Visibility for the type. Valid values are 'Public' and 'Protected'. If blank, uses 'Public'
